originalText: ::At last you step onto dry land, but your eyes see little of it: They've been enthralled by the cavernous firmament doming over you. You gaze upon the stalactitic constellations decorated with dangling roots, gleaming crystals and numerous bat colonies. These stalactites unmistakably insinuate their arbitration over the sea and the land below them, for death from above, while pretty much omnipresent in subterranean life, has a significantly more acute, supreme and inescapably terrifying presence here than anywhere else you've ever been before. This realization pierces you mentally not unlike one of those speleothemic spears could physically.::
::You arrive to the chief's tent after a long and silent ride. ::
Return your equipment and get out of my camp. On the double!
What are you doing here, $(context.player.Name)? Get back to the pirate base! On the double!
We defended the camp. Excellent work, sec-trooper.
Pack your bags, $(context.player.Name). We're moving out.
Shouldn't you be looking for a microchip implant?
$(context.player.Name). I spoke with Doctor Savage about the medical supplies that were sent to muties.
::You find him deep in thought. There is something off about his stare, but you can't tell exactly what. His expression is otherwise austere.::

::You come up to two men having a conversation.::

...They had better be, Ladelman.
You're back. Well, did you think about it?
$(context.player.Name). We're almost ready to move out.
::The chief is silently staring into the long dark tunnel.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::Life underground comes with a plethora of phobias, but this vast place evokes a uniquely crushing, creeping - choking feeling of smallness and utter insignificance in the grand scheme of things. And it is only being exacerbated by the many sounds violently colliding in this open space - those of air currents, restless waters and wild yet unseen life - all the while reverberating deeply and rhythmically as though all of them are combining into one singular heartbeat of the cavern itself. Somewhere out there, in the far distance, you can almost hear the faint but distinct sounds of drums and horns, the prime instruments of the underture to this expeditionary play whose next act has just begun.::

originalText:

He addresses you with surprising self-control.::

What happened?

$(context.player.Name).

originalText: So, I see you were having some fun while I was away.

Ah, welcome to the Hell's Gut. Hope you brought some light clothes, $(context.player.Name), 'cause it's dominatin' hot in here. ::He collects the sweat from his forehead with a handkerchief and squeezes it to the side.:: Yeeeeaah...

The professor was killed during the escape.
I screwed it up. I was too aggressive.
Expect no mercy. Show no mercy.
Your colleagues gave their lives for this expedition. Don't let it all be in vain.

originalText: You called me about something important. What was it?
Chief, I'm afraid Professor Oldfield is dead.
I found this floatie-talkie. This is not a standard issue comm device, as far as I'm aware.
Sir, I need to make short trips outside the Black Sea. Is there someone in the camp who can quickly drive me back and forth?
What happened to the jet skier that was supposed to be driving me in and out of the Black Sea?
I wanted to talk to you about the pirates that were encountered in the Keep.
What do you know about the Ferryman?
What can you tell me about the pirates?
What can you tell me about the recovery teams?
I wanted to ask you about your relationship with Yahota.
What exactly don't you like about Ladelman?
What exactly didn't you like about Ladelman?
I'll leave you to your work, sir.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::His stare falls down and to the side. He is expressionless, just mildlly shaking his head from left to right. After a few moments he turns around and addresses his sec-troopers with a disheartened tone of voice.::

Let's get out of here. Back to the camp!

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Swearing on someone will not make you sound more convincing, Ladelman - results will.

I fought my way to the top, taking the lives of all who stood before me. One by one they fell, until there was no one left to fight. I am the Invictus - the champion of the Arena. If that is not good enough, then there is no human being which can meet your criterion.

I fight in the Arena. My job is to eradicate all who are locked in there with me while the crowd cheers - not for me or someone else, but simply for absolute carnage. My living body is my resume, because for every life I take I get to wake up again.

::Salute him.:: Corporal $(context.player.Name) at your service, sir. That very rank I have received for single-handedly dealing with a group of Free Drones who have hijacked a Protectorate train. For the rest of my accomplishments, contact Fort Apogee and ask to speak with Colonel Cathcart himself.
I am a Praetorian Security enforcer. It is my duty to protect the residents of Core City from all internal and external threats, and to maintain order on the streets no matter what.
I am working for JKK as one of their security operatives. This position is one that requires someone able to performing more demanding tasks in maintaining the organization's security.

I am currently working as a Coretech agent, a member of their security forces. But it is more than standard building security, as agents are expected to perform highly dangerous field work, some of which might take us to the most inhospitable parts of Core City - or farther - in order to protect the company's interests.

I am a senior enforcer in Praetorian Security, and I have been personally promoted to that rank by Chief Archibald Knight himself, who is - as you may know - one of the Core City Oligarchs, for my excellent performance in the line of duty. And now I would like to work for Aegis Incorporated. My skill and experience are at your disposal, sir.

I am working for JKK as one of their security operatives, and I have been commended for my achievements by Gunnar Edstrom himself, the owner of JKK and one of the Core City Oligarchs. I've been sent on some of the most demanding missions, missions that pushed all my skills to the absolute limit. I am the $(#man/woman) who gets things done, sir, and I am at your service.

I am currently working as a Coretech agent, and I've done so much to protect physical and intellectual property of my company that I have been personally promoted by Rupert Simmons himself, the owner of Coretech and one of the Core City Oligarchs. I've shed blood, I've bled my own - I have endured everything thrown at me. Am I not the one you need, sir?

I helped the Foundry Guard halt an invasion of aggressive creatures coming from their mine. Or better yet, I did it all pretty much on my own. And the largest of these creatures - The Beast - is now an empty shell after I flushed its life out with some hot liquid... metal.

I've recently returned from the bowels of South Underrail where I defeated a creature of unspeakable size and horror as well as all of its vile minions, leaving only a grisly scene behind. It's mere presence was crushing my mind, while it's giant tentacles were trying to crush my body, but I prevailed and turned all this evil into bloody mush.

I've single-handedly dealt with a group of Free Drones who have hijacked a Protectorate train headed for Rail Crossing. Hopefully I will be joining Underrail Protectorate forces soon, but in the meantime I've got other things that need my attention.
I've killed an Ironhead boss by the name of Balor. Alone. By walking into his base near Foundry and... doing what I do best.

::[Persuade]:: Look, Chief, this is a Southerner you're talking to. My whole life I've been doing the things you people only do occasionally and only when someone pays you. If I had to go alone to mutant central just to get some stinking drill rotor circuit board, imagine what I gotta endure for more serious things. You want a soldier? Hi, I'm $(context.player.Name), nice to meet ya.
I'll be back with proof that I'm the person you need.
I've heard all I needed to know. I'm in. When are we leaving for the camp?

::[Intelligence]:: Additional staff? Sounds more like *replacement* staff. Your men were killed and you needed more. And it's not the pirates, because you must've prepared for those. No, this is something no one expected, and now you're in trouble. If I'm going to go on this expedition, I'd like to know what's going on.

::[Intelligence]:: Is it really additional staff, or have you experienced more casualties than you had anticipated? Sir, if I am putting my life on the line, I think I have the right to know what I will be facing.
What are you actually looking for there?
I thought you'd bring enough supplies and men to this expedition.
What can you tell me about this community? Who were they? What happened to them?
Will I be able to return to Core City before the expedition is over?
I need to think about it.
I need to think some more.
Very well. You will be directed to your boat soon, $(context.player.Name). I have other things to attend to in the meantime.
Do not make us wait for you...

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: The professor has been kidnapped. The assailants stormed in through this tunnel and overcame our sec-troopers. Two sec-troopers KIA, one MIA, and one staff member is missing as well.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: They had been waiting in the evacuation tunnel when the sec-trooper team opened the gate - waiting for someone to let them in from the other side. That comm device you gave to Marcus, we found the same one on

::Chief Briggs turns to the two of you after ending the conversation with the other man.::

Ladelman. After the laborers have unloaded everything from the boats, show them to their tents. And make sure Marcus receives the equipment he requested as soon as possible; medical tent as well.

::He stares at you.::

Because of your carelessness the professor is dead. Professor Edward Olfield.

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::A moment of disbelief, a moment of realization, then a moment in which he raises his weapon at you.::
You are hereby dismissed from your duty as a sec-trooper, $(context.player.Name).

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Yes, sir. He also explained to me our mission here and introduced me to my first assignment before sending me here.
You really are one persistent troublemaker.
Why did you lie that I allowed donating those supplies?
Pack your bags, $(context.player.Name). I have had enough of you.

If you hadn't shown good performance I'd kick you out of my camp in an instant; but I can't tolerate this kind of behavior either.

I'm cutting your pay in half. You keep up with this behavior and you're out of here. Am I clear?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::The first few seconds are filled with nothing but the sounds of external commotion...::
Indeed. Where did you find it?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: The situation is bad. There are only a handful of sec-troopers left defending the camp.
There are currently $(context.global_xpbl_aegisSecTroopersAvailable) sec-troopers defending the camp.
Why do you need to leave the Black Sea?
I had to pull all our jet skiers back to defend the camp. I've very few sec-troopers left.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: We consider him a minor threat. He was seen entering the pirate territory,

I can offer you little information outside of what you've already seen for yourself. They control the entire northern region of the Black Sea. They employ primitive weapons and technology, but their great numerical advantage, familiarity with the terrain and relentlessness has turned them into an obstacle we haven't been able to overcome.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: There are no active recovery teams right now. We need every sec-trooper in the camp.
There is currently only one active recovery team, Alfa. It's essentially a fireteam composed of five of my best sec-troopers.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: He's undisciplined, stubborn, and most of his traits are the exact opposite of what I desire in my sec-troopers and staff in general. I am a man who requires little sleep, yet dealing with him makes me need twice the time I usually dedicate to it.

He was undisciplined, stubborn, and most of his traits are the exact opposite of what I desire in my sec-troopers and staff in general. I am a man who requires little sleep, yet dealing with him made me need twice the time I usually dedicate to it.

originalText: I don't know a lot about local affairs. However...

originalText: A giant creature from the deep? Is this a joke?
Mutant central? What kind of language is that?
I didn't ask you to hold a speech, but to convince me why I should hire you. I'm waiting.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Be it your way. As long as you don't waste too much of my time.

originalText: Very good. Welcome aboard - consider yourself a security trooper for the duration of this expedition. You will receive your gear as soon as we return to the camp. There you will also be introduced to the rest of the staff as well as to Professor Oldfield himself.

originalText:

Don't repeat this mistake...

originalText: Your payment will largely depend on the task you will be performing: Guard duty payment ranges from fifty to one hundred charons per day - the average is around seven per hour; escort and recovery duties are paid double or triple that, depending on a range of factors.

Now pack your bags; we'll be moving out soon.

originalText:
::With a freezing, austere expression, the man turns around to go elsewhere - and sees you. A mere glance at him can't but make you feel that this is the type of person who reigns over every bit of land he sets his foot on, no matter how small, insignificant or someone else's it might be. And he is without a doubt the person you're looking for today.::

Who are you?

I overheard you speakin', sir, and wanted to confirm what this $(#man/woman) here's talkin' about, yeah. One of the new laborers is from Foundry, and he told me about what happened, you know, with
I don't have time for this nonsense. Convince me why I should hire you, or be on your way.

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Excuse me, but $(#he/she) probably means Old Junkyard. Eh, right?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::Your nerves are now screaming for mercy as the powerful hand squeezes them lifeless. For a moment, every part of your body but your shoulder has been expelled from your mind's domain, as you feel nothing other than this acute pain. Thankfully, the chief releases his grip after but a few seconds.::

...because the consequences will be severe.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: It is true, we have suffered casualties. We have lost a few good soldiers to the pirates and the wildlife. These are the risks of this job. Some of the workers - Southerners - have become unsettled, panic-stricken or have suffered illness and wanted to abandon the expedition. Some of our own staff got sick as well. All of these are relatively minor setbacks, but enough to slow us down and force us to an earlier trip to Core City than we had planned.
What do you mean by escort and recovery?
Right now you and I have other things to discuss first.
What we haven't planned, and couldn't possibly, is the railroad blockade.
Most of your duties should not require any trips outside of the Black Sea, however.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Pirates. This was a planned and well-coordinated attack. They moved in with EMPs and concussion grenades before storming in. Unfortunately, Professor Oldfield was in the office right next to the tunnel; he was seized immediately.
It appears that your actions have prevented a disaster, $(context.player.Name); if you hadn't discovered the collaborator, these pirates would have likely caught us off guard.

You, $(context.player.Name), the tent you will be sleeping in is just ahead, the first one to the left, opposite the kitchen. Unpack your things and meet me at Professor Oldfield's tent as soon as you've done so; it's the small tent just past yours, also on the left side.
I also see you've collected your gear from Marcus.
Have you collected your gear from Marcus?
I have had enough of your crap as well, Chief.
This is rather unusual. We only issue Redigner navcoms.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: we've disregarded him as being actively involved with the pirates.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: However, what worries me the most is the fact that he is also sailing through native waters completely uncontested. What kind of relationship he has with them is something we've not been able to determine yet, as he was uncooperative whenever he was approached.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: They are mostly concentrated in the southern bay and along the eastern coast and have regular jet ski patrols along their perimeter and within the bay. They mostly employ light to heavy firearms and other low-tech projectile weapons, but their fortifications also have large-caliber machine guns, especially at their main base.

Nothing that would prepare us for what we encountered here. They were an unexpected threat which has, together with pirates, wildlife, disease and environmental conditions forced us into this deadlock we're in.

And yet, we are still unable to understand the exact relations between natives and the pirates, although I find it highly doubtful that they've formed any kind of alliance, based on our observations.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: They're on channel six on your navcom if you need to contact them.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I'm not answering those kinds of questions, $(context.player.Name).
Stop bothering me with nonsense or I'll throw you out of my tent.
That having been said, he was the most competent person to have applied to be our guide to the Black Sea,
I don't follow Southern broadcasts, especially not when--
Everyone in South Underrail watches the Arena, sir. It's pipes and barrels, sir.

Excuse me, sir - I kinda overheard your conversation - but one of the new laborers happens to be from Rail Crossin', and he actually told me about all of this just a few hours ago. It's real. It happened. It's hardcore!
I'm afraid that is not good enough. You need more experience if you want to be hired. I do not need rookies.
this Beast. They had this, you know, public appearance and the whole Foundry was there. It was hardcore, he told me. Filly, The Laborer. Not in those words, though.

Balor. These Ironheads are the scourge of South Underrail, and one of their clans grew to become really big and hardcore, the one near Foundry. Balor's the leader, and there was a bounty on his head, and this $(#guy/girl) came in and collected it like a boss. His words. Filly's. He's the laborer.
::He then takes a step back.:: You have the absolute right to know what you will be getting yourself into, but I will *not* tolerate this kind of behavior again.
However, we will not allow any of that to affect our mission too negatively. We're almost finished in Core City and will soon resume with our mission.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Escort teams escort scientific personnel to certain locations and protect them while they perform their work there. Recovery teams work independently, operating in areas unsafe for scientific personnel, like abandoned facilities and other establishments, with the tasks of recovering items of interest: technological equipment, armament, personal items, various samples, et cetera...
I expect that to be rectified soon, however.
But that has been almost completely rectified, as I have been informed, so that is excellent news.
The pirates detonated explosives in the evacuation tunnel during their retreat. We cannot pursue them, because there is nothing but water now behind this gate. They closed automatically, it seems.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Why do you think they went through all this trouble to attack us like this?
Get out of my sight before I strangle you.

We're pulling out. I can at least save the lives of my sec-troopers and the expeditionary staff.

You are hereby dismissed from your duty as a sec-trooper, $(context.player.Name).

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
Empty your footlocker, turn in your navcom and armor to Marcus and leave the island. 

You may not return to the island. If you interfere with our operations here, my sec-troopers will not hesistate to use force.
Give it to Marcus for inspection. This is a huge security risk and must be investigated ASAP.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Very well. I'll allow it. A jet skier will be waiting for you at the docks. Do what you need to do, and make it quick.
He is lightly armed and for the time being best avoided.
and he had qualities one could've relied on,
and he has qualities one could rely on,
No one is walking without a purpose while I'm in charge of this dock. ::The sound of the motor rotating his mechanical arm reinforces his statement.:: Who are you?

Invictus! $(context.playerArenaTitle)! It's you - it really *is* you. I thought you looked bloody familiar, but... but... You look so damn different in person. Yeeeaaah... this is *so* freakin' hardcore.

Man...
::He points to you.:: Have you seen this $(#man/woman) before?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: before we hired 'im, and he heard a few employees talkin' about some newcomer who only started workin' and already $(#he/she)'s one of the boss' new favorites. That's what the folks were sayin'.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Thank you, Ladelman, that would be all.
How much longer before we are able to return to the camp?

::You calmly grab his mechanical hand with both of yours - just as he was about to squeeze you harder - and pull it away from your shoulder, all the while calmly staring into his eyes, displaying little effort despite there being a lot involved. ::
::In a few swift and elegant motions you twist yourself out of his grasp - just as he was about to squeeze you harder. ::
And next time I won't be as gentle.
Or, as I like to call these recovery teams - scavenger teams, yeah.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::[Intelligence]:: Chief, we have a mole. The pirates attacked us at a time far too perfect for it to be a lucky coincidence.
How did they know where the professor was?

There is only one explanation: They wanted Professor Oldfield. A sneak attack, even if successful, wouldn't allow them to neutralize too many sec-troopers to really affect the numbers in their favor. They opted for a precision strike in which they either wanted to assassinate the professor, or what would be more likely scenario, to kidnap him.
When do I get my equipment, sir?
Would you mind if I got to know the rest of the camp first?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Before we begin I need to speak to you about your attitude. More precisely,

Your assignment is to find a working microchip so that we can pass the authentication and authorization scan in order to enter the Keep and other facilities; *if* the data Seeger has recovered is correct, but we have little reason to doubt it at this point. You might've noticed that there is no one else present with us. That's because you will be going on this mission alone.
Do see him after we're finished here.
Now get out of my sight.
Before I leave, there was something else...
If you need any further information, Yahota is tracking him from the top of the lighthouse.

Of course. There were a number of incidents when we first arrived, mostly between our and their jet patrols. They were aggressive, but we came prepared and have managed to repel all of their incursions into our territory.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
like his competence with jet ski and firearm maintenance, the latter of which earned him his post in the supply tent with Marcus.

...and away from trouble.
I was told you are hiring mercenaries for an expedition. I want to join.
Ladelman, what are you on about?

::The man takes a closer look at you. You wait for recognition from your fellow Southerner; after all, he stated himself that everyone watches the Arena here. Unfortunately, all you see is him shaking his head sideways.::

No, sir, 'fraid not. I don't recognize $(#'im/'er). I haven't had the time to watch a couple of recent matches, but if $(#he/she) was even semi-hardcore I'd know about $(#'im/'er).

::The man takes a closer look at you. His eyes are focused and unreadable at first but soon become ignited by the spark of recognition.::

$(context.playerArenaTitle)! It's you! I thought you looked familiar, but... but... You look so damn different in person. Oh, this is so hardcore. An actual gladiator. Here!
Yes, sir, it's true. Swear on me... uh... It happened. $(#He/She) zoned out some serious ass over there, from what I've heard. You can ask the man himself. He's the--
I never knew I was that famous.

Well, sir, uh... it's the old part of... uh, Junkyard. You know, sir, Junkyard, the, um, settlement where the United Stations embassy's located. This Old Junkyard is full of horribly mutated beings, all twisted and disgustin'. And very hostile. So if this $(#man/woman) here went to this place for some stupid crap - pardon my expression, sir - then... $(#he/she)'s pretty dominatin' hardcore.

Oh, yes. We're almost done loadin' the medical supplies, sir. We've got, I think... ::He looks at his mobile computer.:: Yeah, frozen meat and power cell crates... and, yes, most of the electronic equipment Marcus requested still remains to be loaded... aaaand that's it. 

Yup. I'd say we'll be ready in one hour or so, sir.
::You can see he's surprised - perhaps even impressed - yet he doesn't sound it but instead merely abandons his original course of action in silence.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Just after we had entered the Keep but right before the recovery team returned and conducted a sweep of the evacuation tunnels. Someone gave them accurate intel, but not only that - the pirates somehow managed to unlock the gate.
Someone told them. There has to be a traitor in our ranks, for their timing could not have been better.
We avoided all of that, thankfully.

::He nods and turns to Ladelman.::

And if you see Yahota, tell her to meet me in my tent in about twenty or so minutes. I want her full report on what has been happening in my absence.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: As soon as you receive your briefing.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Unpack your things and meet me at the professor's tent, as I've already told you.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: It was an honor working for Aegis Incorporated, sir.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: your impertinent comments at the dock
your obnoxious complaining in the professor's tent
I have no issue with that.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: It's been a pleasure, sir. Goodbye.
You've made a big mistake, Chief.
I was starting to get sick of this place anyway. So long, Chief.
I hope all of you sons of rats get eaten by sea serpents.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: But we didn't come here to wage wars: It wasn't our original plan to have a permanent camp on this island, as we are in the open and could be observed and attacked from all sides, not to mention it would exacerbate the tensions with the pirates due to our proximity to their positions; we instead planned to move further north, unaware of the native presence there.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::He scans you again, this time more intently, then crosses his arms. As flesh and machine interweave to the sound of mechanical motion, the chief continues.::

You have been told where you'd be going, correct? The Black Sea is ruthless. It shows no mercy to the untrained and to the unprepared - both physically and mentally. I need only the most competent and most resilient people I can find...

You don't understand, sir. This $(#man/woman) here defeated the greatest gladiator in the history of the Arena - Carnifex. The man who ate gladiators for breakfast, lunch, dinner and perhaps another dinner if he had some more room left. And the match between the two of them, it was... I remember when Carnifex showed up...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I've heard enough. I am not convinced yet.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Thank you, Ladelman. That would be enough.
Well, Brick - the janitor - says they call you a pipeworker and a lickspittle, but I guess they're just envious sons of--

::He looks at you for a second, then nods a few times.:: Yes. I have yet to actually see you in action, but for now I am satisfied enough with what you... ::He glances behind him.:: and Ladelman had told me. For now...

Alright, $(context.player.Name), listen up...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Thank you, Ladelman, that would be enough.
Very good, very good. ::He nods a few times.:: That is faster than I thought. Very good.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Therefore... ::He glances again at Ladelman before fixating on you.:: the exact payment depends on the area of operation and danger involved. Superior performance might also induce considerable bonuses to previously mentioned figures.

::It all happens in an instant: A mechanical hand seizes you by the neck, and one blink later you feel a pair of cold rifle barrels kissing your temples. One move and you are dead, either by having your brains blown to smithereens or by having your windpipe crushed like a plastic bottle.::
We have had disagreements since you arrived here, and even if I still stand by what I had said, I have to admit that you are capable of producing good results.

::He hands you a key to a jet ski.::

You earned it.
Yes, yes, sir. I will, sir.
You will speak to Marcus about that... but he has other work to do at the moment.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: and your obnoxious complaining in the professor's tent.
as well as that stupid joke about mistaking his tent for a kitchen.

I will give you the reason in just a moment. The West Storage Depot is where we're likely to find one of these microchips since it's the only facility that's currently accessible. However, during our original recon of the Black Sea we've noticed several locations where engagements between NFT and Biocorp forces have taken place; there could be bodies there with functional microchips, but we'll need to do a more thorough search of the areas.

::[Strength] Show him your flexed biceps, then triceps and lastly put great emphasis on your significant - especially for a woman - deltoid muscles.::

Not just any woman...
I need soldiers, to put it simply. Otherwise you are of no use to this expedition.
This $(#guy/girl)'s hardcore. You defeated Master Exploder, yeah?
That would be enough, Ladelman. And speaking of which, do these new laborers do any work or do they chat with you constantly, seeing that you seem to know all of their personal stories?

We - Aegis Incorporated - have been employed to protect a team of scientists from the University of Dis undertaking an expedition to the Black Sea, or as it's known by the locals - the Hell's Gut. The sea lies in a vast, unexplored cavern, where a technologically advanced community existed until about two and a half to three centuries ago.

If only you could see it, sir... ::He frowns.:: and the abominations that live there. Yeeeeeah, your run-of-the-mill muties ain't *nothin'* compared to some of the more repugnant creatures-- Like, I've recently heard a story about this pipeworkin' two-headed muta--
You heard it. If you have anything else to do before we set sail, now is the time. Do not be late.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: That is all. Carry on with your tasks.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I don't wish to hear any excuses or further comments, I just need you to listen to me carefully:

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: These locations are close to native territory, so I'll dispatch one heavily-armed recovery team to investigate these locations as soon as I'm done with you. Meanwhile, West Storage Depot is located not too far from here, and while not free of danger it's less likely to turn into a war zone. Therefore, we'll have several locations covered which increases our chances of finding these microchips; if we're able to do that quickly and before the natives are able to reconsolidate their forces and attack us again, we will be able to withdraw all our teams back to the camp in time for defense.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Sir, you've got yourself a death machine here. The best! The most hardcore! Them pipeworkers in the Hell's Gut ain't gonna know what zoned them out when--
That's right. That was my last match.
We're usin' our hands for work, sir, our mouths and ears are free.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I don't have anything important left to do. I'll wait here until the crates have been loaded up.
I won't. I'll be with you once I'm done finishing a few things.

You. You appeared out of nowhere at that dock and asked to join the expedition. Ladelman was very quick to back up your story. You acquired that implant quickly and helped us enter a building that had been sealed for centuries - only to have a band of dimwitted pirates open it from the other side and catch my sec-troopers off guard.

That kind of behavior is unacceptable while you're under my command. I already have to deal with Ladelman's Southern shenanigans, but that is something I have little say in. You, however, are now a sec-trooper for and you better start acting like it.
Am I clear? Or do I need to repeat what I've just told you?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Understood. What can you tell me about the West Storage Depot?
Our jet ski numbers are very good.
We have a sufficient number of jet skis left.
We have lost a large number of jet skis.
We barely have any jet skis left.
I wouldn't be here if I didn't think I was up to the task.
A soldier you will get, sir, believe me.
You're talking to a Southern woman, sir. I've got what it takes, you can count on it.
How about you tell me a bit more about this expedition before we go on?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: This is no time to chat, Ladelman.
Sorry, I haven't had the time to watch it lately, but I saw that one.

After this community was no more, nature reclaimed the sea. The resulting closed ecosystem has produced a large number of unique and aggressive species which, in tandem with pirates and other inhabitants who have settled in various parts of the region currently pose the largest threats to the expeditionary staff. In addition to that, remnants of this community's defense systems could still be online, which adds another layer of danger we have to account for.
::He nods.:: Very well. You'll be notified when that happens. I have other things to attend to in the meantime.

And then... they collapsed the tunnel so that we couldn't go after them, which means they clearly have access to and knowledge of these facilities, and by how fast you brought us that implant - so do you.
I can't imagine why you haven't yet been thrown out of the Protectorate, behaving like this. You are a soldier - act like one.
I am sorry, sir. It will not happen again.
I do what I want, Chief. It's who I am.
Can you say that one more time?

It's currently home to a community of muties. We haven't tried making any contact with them so far; you'll be our first representative. Our jet ski patrols have approached the island a few times, and while the muties did not respond with hostility it doesn't mean that they won't to your presence, especially not after this attack; we don't know anything of their relations with the natives but all our observations so far have shown the area to be free of natives.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Convince me then. Why should I hire you?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Not until I know you're worth it.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Yes, yes, sir. But this, this $(#man/woman) here got the heart and the body of a fighter, sir. I've seen that match, Master Exploder, and when they got in there, and the blood, and--

This is just a brief summary; you will receive the full briefing should you choose to join the expedition, in which case these are the options regarding your duties as a sec-trooper: Either you will be assigned to basic camp security, to an escort team or to a recovery team; given your experience, the last two options are more probable, but that I will have to decide once we return to the camp.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: To summarize, you are to sail west to B7, enter the NFT facility and attempt to obtain a functional A-RFID microchip. If the muties are cooperative, try to extract any useful information from them. How you choose to accomplish your assignment is up to you.
In addition to that we have lost

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::The rugged man behind the chief turns his head and observes you for a few moments. You read some kind of uncertainty on his face, uncertainty about you, but you aren't able to gather the reason behind it. You've never seen that man before, but could it be that he's seen you?::
I didn't get the impression that there was a camp already.
And I wondered why there were so few people here. So how long have you been at the Black Sea already?

We haven't received a ransom note yet or anything of the kind. Was that your job - or someone else's? Ladelman's? Are the laborers involved too? What other machinations are unfolding right now? When is the next backstab coming?
I am terribly sorry for what I have done, sir. I will not disrespect you ever again, sir.
I said: I'll think about it.
I said: I do what I want, Chief. It's who I am.
I said: Can you say that one more time?
You can forget about your first paycheck. If you persist with this behavior you can forget about being paid altogether - for you will find yourself back on the Core City docks.
This concludes your briefing. Sec-trooper Jenkins is back from patrol and is waiting for you at the docks to give you the keys to your jet ski; you will need it to reach the island.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: We had set up our camp two weeks ago. We've returned here for supplies and additional staff.

::He pauses, staring at you with that determination from before.::

I will let you speak. But if you move anything but your mouth you will die.

::He lets you breathe again.::
This is the key to your Aegis Patroller jet ski. It has been given to you by Chief Briggs of Aegis Incorporated.

Very good. In that case I will not be cutting your paycheck, but mark my words: Next time you will find yourself at the Core City docks, no further warnings or pay cuts or anything of the sort. Next time will be your last.
I have nothing further to add, so let us move on...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: But I don't know how to ride a jet ski.
I am looking forward to riding one, sir.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: The fat... technician... ::gasp:: floatie-talkie... I showed you... remember?
I had... ::gasp:: nothing to do with this, I swear! You have... ::gasp:: to believe me!
Put those... guns away... ::gasp:: you bastards. Are you derailed? I am... ::gasp:: on your side.
You... ::gasp:: saw right through... ::gasp:: me... Chief... Because I am... a PIRATE! ::Attack!::
I don't know if you call them here differently, but I'm talking about single-seat jet-propelled vessels. You've seen them at the dock.
The ones we use are quite simple to operate. Jenkins will tell you all you need to know.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::He pauses.:: Yes...

The one I instructed you to bring to Marcus?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::He motions one of the guards.::

Search $(#him/her).

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Would you mind answering a couple of questions before I leave?
::Salute him.:: Thank you, sir. I will get that microchip.
Which you didn't. Or else Marcus would've traced it back.
::After going through your gear, the guard turns to the chief. ::
You've been told all you need to know.
Only if it is something important.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I was going to, but I didn't get the chance at the time because of everything that has been happening.

::He found that floatie-talkie you took from one of the camp's technicians.::

Got something, sir. It's a floatie-talkie, sir.

::He found a floatie-talkie you took from the Rig.::

Got something, sir. It's a floatie-talkie, sir.

::He found a comm device you acquired earlier.::

Got something, sir. This is not one of our navcoms.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::Salute him.:: Understood, sir. I will get that microchip.
Tell me, $(context.player.Name), why would you need a communication device when we had already equipped you with one of ours? And one the pirates use as well.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I used that for some other job. You know I did a lot of stuff before I joined this expedition, Chief.
Sir, that technician is *the* missing staff member.
Chief, sir - I understand what you're going through right now: You hold great responsibilities and are certainly a man of great dedication. But please, do not let your anger misdirect you.
Time to end this nonsense, sir.
I know, sec-trooper. ::He points at you.:: If $(#he/she) is working with the pirates, $(#he/she) would most certainly try to use that man as a scapegoat, a conveniently absent scapegoat.
And $(#he/she) knows it. That is why $(#he/she) is trying to use him as a scapegoat, a conveniently absent scapegoat.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I got that on the Rig, from a Black Eel. Check the insignia on the back.
::[Persuasion]:: That is not mine! This device belonged to one of the camp's technicians, the fat one wearing suspenders. He dropped it and I picked it up.
I need that for other work.

However... ::He looks at you: The reflection in his eyes now has another constituent - doubt.::

::He continues staring at you in silence.::
::And so he does, yet he still looks back at you with suspicion.::
I did not betray you - someone else did. You mentioned one other staff member who went missing during the attack. Who was it?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Why was this technician in the Keep?
It was a technician we picked up at Core City. Larry Lovitz. He was hired for his experience in the fields of mechanics and electronics.
Seeger said he called him down to help him with the elevator; he wanted to try and gain access to the lower levels, but it appears they have all been flooded.
And Seeger had stored the authentication signal into his SLS. The very signal the implant you recovered was transmitting. One moment of Seeger's carelessness...
Do you think Seeger is in on it as well?
I think you owe me an apology, Chief.
There. You got your backstabbing Southerner.
I was too hasty to blame you. I lost sight of everything else. This technician... Seeger, it is all so obvious now.
::He frowns, but chooses not to comment on your remark.::
Now what, Chief? How do we get the professor back?
He was on a lunch break.
We either seek to negotiate, or we infiltrate their base and rescue him.
Directly attacking them should be our last option, but even infiltration holds great risks due to our unfamiliarity with the terrain and professor's location.
These are our only options. There are only a few sec-troopers left alive; directly attacking the pirate stronghold would be equal to comitting suicide.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I've killed some pirates since I got here, so I hope they won't shoot me on sight since I think negotiating is the safest option we have right now.
Then we should play it safe: We should try to negotiate.

I've already done some violent negotiating with them, and I doubt they'd like some more. Moreover, how can we be certain they want to negotiate at all? We received no word from them as yet. Let me take care of this on my own. I've got my ways.
How can we be certain they want to negotiate at all? We received no word from those bastards, and we've seen how trigger-happy they are. Let me take care of this on my own. I've got my ways.
I'd rather trust sea serpents than those salty ratbags. I'll be in and out with the professor by my side before they even realize what happened.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I've already dispatched Yahota on a recon mission inside the pirate territory. But she has yet to report to me.
If only Yahota were still alive. We'd have a keen pair of eyes in the pirate territory.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::He pauses yet again, but the pause is briefer than the previous time.::
Infiltration it is, then. We cannot trust the pirates.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I volunteer, Chief. I'm a Southerner and have dealt with all kinds of scum this region has to offer. I think it would be wiser if you'd let me do it.
Yahota's eyes will be yours as soon as she's in position. Contact her over the navcom before moving in.
You will be alone out there. We have no recon of their territory, so you will have to find a way to infiltrate their base on your own.
Very well then, $(context.player.Name). I give you full authority to negotiate in my name.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: If infiltration proves impossible or too risky, then you have my full authority to negotiate in my name.
From the moment we arrived there has always been a pirate jet ski patrol in F4, just outside their base; you should try approaching them.
My sec-troopers will be on standby; if things go fubar, use the navcom and we'll move in as soon as possible.
Stay sharp, as you won't be having any sec-troopers supporting you.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Prove to me that I made the right call - liberate Professor Oldfield.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
